Package ohos.agp.render.render3d

Class RenderLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.render.render3d.RenderLoop

  • public class RenderLoop
extends Object
    Auxiliary class used to manage rendering.

    This class provides methods to start, stop, pause, or resume rendering loops, and to add or cancel tasks in the rendering loops.

    Since:
    3

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  RenderLoop.FrameListener
      Provides the listener for frame rendering events.

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • setRenderNodeGraph

        public void setRenderNodeGraph​(Engine.RenderNodeGraph renderNodeGraph)
        Sets the rendering node graph.

        This method is used to configure the rendering pipeline. You can also use setRenderNodeGraph(ohos.agp.render.render3d.Engine.RenderNodeGraphType) to apply the default configuration.

        Parameters:
        renderNodeGraph - Indicates the rendering node graph.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if the parameter is null.

      • setRenderNodeGraph

        public void setRenderNodeGraph​(Engine.RenderNodeGraphType renderNodeGraphType)
        Sets the rendering node graph using a set of predefined options.
        Parameters:
        renderNodeGraphType - Indicates the rendering node graph used for rendering.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Throws this exception if the parameter is null.

        public void startRendering​()
        Starts the rendering loop.

      • submitTask

        public void submitTask​(Task task)
        Add a task that is to be executed in the rendering loop.
        Parameters:
        task - Indicates the task to execute.

      • cancelTask

        public boolean cancelTask​(Task task)
        Cancels a task in the queue.
        Parameters:
        task - Indicates the task to cancel.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the task is cleared from the queue; returns false otherwise.

      • cancelAllTasks

        public void cancelAllTasks​()
        Cancels all tasks that are being executed.

      • requestRender

        public void requestRender​()
        Requests rendering on a frame. The rendering on the next frame will start forcibly even if the scene is not in dirty state.

      • stopRendering

        public void stopRendering​()
        Stops the rendering loop.

        Pause rendering.

      • resume

        public void resume​()
        Resumes the rendering that has been paused.

      • setFrameListener

        public void setFrameListener​(RenderLoop.FrameListener frameListener)
        Sets the listener for frame events.
        Parameters:
        frameListener - Indicates the listener for frame events.

      • setVsyncCount

        public void setVsyncCount​(int vsyncCount)
        Sets the vertical synchronization (VSync) based on the rendering frequency. This method can be used to set the rendering frequency target, which depends on the V-Sync of the device.

        The rendering frequency values 1, 2, and 3 indicate the rendering is performed on every frame, every other frame, and every three frames respectively. For example, if the VSync is 60 Hz and the rendering frequency value is 2, the rendering frame rate is 30 fps.

        Parameters:
        vsyncCount - v-sync based rendering frequency.

      • getVsyncCount

        public int getVsyncCount​()
        Obtains the V-Sync based on rendering restrictions. For details, see setVsyncCount(int).
        Returns:
        Returns the VSync based on rendering restrictions.

      • release

        public void release​()
        Releases the rendering loop.
